Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Ultrasound-Guided Percutaneous Cryoneurolysis for Traumatic Rib Fractures

Participants.evidence: adults with one to six rib fractures were enrolled at the University of California-San Diego

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to active cryoneurolysis with sham peripheral nerve block or sham cryoneurolysis with active peripheral nerve block

Objective.evidence: This study evaluated the efficacy of ultrasound-guided percutaneous cryoneurolysis in improving analgesia and inspired volume.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was maximum inspired volume measured with an incentive spirometer the day after the procedure.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by laterality using sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between April 2020 and August 2023, 20 participants were randomised: 11 to cryoneurolysis and 9 to peripheral nerve block.

Number_Analysed.evidence: 11 to cryoneurolysis and 9 to peripheral nerve block

Result_Outcome.evidence: The adjusted mean difference in maximum inspired volume was 793 ml greater in the cryoneurolysis group (95% CI, 273 to 1,312 ml; p = 0.005).

Harms.evidence: One adverse event of pneumonia occurred in the cryoneurolysis group.

Funding.evidence: Epimed International provided funding and devices.
